text: Hey does anyone have a workflow/toolchain for working with Jupyter Notebooks from within a terminal emulator?

elements.text: Hey does anyone have a workflow/toolchain for working with Jupyter Notebooks from within a terminal emulator?

text: E.g. `Weave.jl` has functionality for extracting a vector of the cells in the notebook etc.

elements.text: has functionality for extracting a vector of the cells in the notebook etc.

text: Working with: executing cells from a script and seeing the state and outputs in a Jupyter kernel simultaneously. I forgot that weave has those abilities - thanks for the reminder <@U67G3QRJM>

elements.text: Working with: executing cells from a script and seeing the state and outputs in a Jupyter kernel simultaneously. I forgot that weave has those abilities - thanks for the reminder

text: I don't know how you could update the output in a notebook. There's also NBInclude.jl

elements.text: I don't know how you could update the output in a notebook. There's also NBInclude.jl

text: Oh wait, I figured something out! Sorry for bothering! I am just going to use a floating terminal in my interface to get the job done. :slightly_smiling_face:
